#Text={ +Chapter Seven+ }
#Text=It is dark here in the forest .
#Text=The leaves rustle over our head , black against the last gold of the sky .
#Text=The moss is soft and warm .
#Text=We shall sleep on this moss for many nights , till the beasts of the forest come to tear our body .
#Text=We have no bed now , save the moss , and no future , save the beasts .
#Text=We are old now , yet we were young this morning , when we carried our glass box through the streets of the City to the Home of the Scholars .
#Text=No men stopped us , for there were none about [ -from- ] the Palace of Corrective Detention , and the others knew nothing .
#Text=No men stopped us at the gate .
#Text=We walked through { +the+ } empty passages and into the great hall where the World Council of Scholars sat in solemn meeting .
#Text=We saw nothing as we entered , save the sky in the great windows , blue and glowing .
#Text=Then we saw the Scholars who sat around a long table ; they were as shapeless clouds huddled at the rise of [ -the- ] { +a+ } great sky .
#Text=There were { +the+ } men whose famous names we knew , and others from distant lands whose names we had not heard .
#Text=We saw a great painting on the wall over their heads , of the twenty illustrious men who had invented the candle .
#Text=All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered .
#Text=These great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us , and they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity , as if we were a miracle .
#Text=It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with brown stains which had been blood .
#Text=We raised our right arm and we said :
#Text=" Our greeting to you , our honored brothers of the World Council of Scholars ! "
#Text=Then Collective 0-0009 , the oldest and wisest of the Council , spoke and asked :
#Text=" Who are you , our brother ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Our name is [ -Equality- ] { +Equity+ } 7-2521 , " we answered , " and we are a Street Sweeper of this City . "

column1: #Text=Then [ -is- ] { +it+ } was [ -as- ] if a great wind had stricken the hall , for all the Scholars spoke at once , and they were angry and frightened .
#Text=" A Street Sweeper !

#Text=It is not to be believed !

#Text=It is against all the rules and all the laws !

column1: #Text=" We matter not , nor our transgression .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Still they would not move .

#Text= We give you the power of the sky ! " we cried .

column1: #Text=" We give you the key to the earth !
#Text=" Have you nothing to say to us ? "
#Text=Then Collective 0-0009 moved forward .
#Text=They moved to the table and the others followed .
#Text=" Yes , " spoke Collective 0-0009 , " we have much to say to you . "
#Text=The sound of their [ -voices- ] { +voice+ } brought silence to the hall and to [ -be- ] { +the+ } beat of our heart .
#Text=" Yes , " said Collective 0-0009 , " we have much to say to a wretch who have broken all the laws and who boast of their infamy !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= How dared you , gutter cleaner , " spoke Fraternity 9-3452 , " to hold yourself as one alone and with the thoughts of [ -the- ] one and not of [ -the- ] many ? "
